Principles of Real Estate.Description: The fundamentals of real estate productivity and value are developed. Legal elements of real estate transactions, physical aspects of real estate location and production, and economic factors pertinent to real estate.

TechnicalAndDigitalSkills: Proficiency in real estate valuation and investment models
Knowledge of legal elements in real estate transactions
Understanding of economic factors affecting real estate
Application of digital tools for real estate analysis
Competence in real estate financing and ownership arrangements
InterpersonalAndCommunicationSkills: Effective communication in real estate negotiations
Building professional networks within the real estate industry
Engaging with clients and stakeholders in property transactions
Collaboration with interdisciplinary teams in real estate projects
Facilitating discussions on real estate investment strategies
ProblemSolvingAndAnalyticalSkills: Critical thinking in real estate productivity and value analysis
Developing innovative solutions for real estate challenges
Evaluating economic and physical aspects of property locations
Synthesizing data for informed real estate decisions
Analyzing market trends to identify investment opportunities
OrganizationalAndLeadershipSkills: Planning and managing real estate projects
Time management in appraisal and transaction processes
Leading real estate investment analysis teams
Organizing internships and professional development in real estate
Strategic planning for real estate business decisions

Real Estate Internship.Description: A faculty supervised, professionally oriented project. Approval for enrollment and allowable credits is determined by the department chair. A transfer student must have completed one semester at Old Dominion University.
